document.title: Arkansas Department of Education Division of Career and Technical Education Animal Science Standards

087531187E8141069B7A2E2DE65F0E6C.description:
Identify and summarize methods for ensuring optimal environmental conditions for
animals.

164F0DBE0F4D42D4BA74544271AC0134.description:
Research and summarize environmental conditions that impact animals (e.g., weather,
sources of water, food resources, etc.).

5DA00DF4AE2249C1A481A080DD4B22EE.description:
Evaluate the effects of environmental conditions on animals and create plans to ensure favorable
environments for animals.

2DA072A7FEEE412EBACBFF7314431039.description:
Identify and summarize the effects of animal agriculture on the environment (e.g., waste
disposal, carbon footprint, air quality, environmental efficiencies, etc.).

521CE07DA9DB46A38E641233C9FB5994.description: Design and implement methods to reduce the effects of animal production on the environment.

C2C06399F1594147A8E816068B1CE6AF.description: Analyze environmental factors associated with animal production.

478E95246580444284C9C5B141531C8D.description:
Identify and describe zoonotic diseases including their historical significance and
potential future implications.

B90F479CB30B4D0C87066DE60C2CF767.description:
Analyze procedures at the local, state and national levels to ensure biosecurity of the
animal industry.

03EE195CE2854272A7318DBBD6963AC1.description:
Summarize the importance of biosecurity to the animal industry at multiple levels (e.g.,
local, state, national, global).

59FDF9B71277472A841466B4EE724C8C.description:
Analyze biosecurity measures utilized to protect the welfare of animals on a local, state, national
and global level.

0FA3F14BD50A4B92AB0C76FE6CF67052.description:
Identify and summarize characteristics of causal agents and vectors of diseases and
disorders in animals.

E8F46D05A582423384AA827FFC80B69C.description:
List and summarize the characteristics of wounds, common diseases, parasites and
physiological disorders that affect animals.

890F3A2C54484D48AD1554635A9254CB.description: Explain methods of determining animal health and disorders.

FAF24B63DF374D5EB6F327E51C58496A.description:
Identify and summarize specific tools and technology used in animal health
management.

A8FE0C00B05D445BBE48F8A2764B7C5F.description:
Design programs to prevent animal diseases, parasites and other disorders and ensure animal
welfare.

594895213AA74043BBDF6E26FD94820F.description: Apply principles of effective animal health care.

48AC523B24EA4714BC0D0FBB9DE45DBB.description:
Identify and summarize how an animal’s health can be affected by anatomical and
physiological disorders.

69BC92E3C3F542F3A0903BA9C01A187F.description:
Select and train animals for specific purposes and maximum performance based on anatomy and
physiology.

AF7CA4FCEB874C62B52E147BD1A31CC9.description:
Compare and contrast animal cells, tissues, organs, body systems types and functions
among animal species.

553E9DCD4BF74CF2985DBC9A279CFAF1.description:
Identify and summarize the properties, locations, functions and types of animal cells,
tissues, organs and body systems.

FE6970B8A4544DD7B334E38FEB31F5F0.description: Examine the basic functions of animal cells in animal growth and reproduction.

4DDCFA704C054C569C97B30155C2C937.description: Analyze the functions of each animal cell structure.

6FACCAE45C1346FB899909043F52FF9C.description:
Research and summarize characteristics of a typical animal cell and identify the
organelles.

5EDA40C2ADFD48A8B556BC48A66B2892.description: Apply principles of comparative anatomy and physiology to uses within various animal systems.

B5A234589732492980DFF22EAA7FBC12.description:
Compare and contrast major uses of different animal species (e.g., agricultural,
companion, etc.).

5715BAE7A0F34760940DE662E2CC8B95.description: Explain the importance of the binomial nomenclature system for classifying animals.

51D78E4D09ED4FDFAA8EA3E198288273.description:
Classify animals according to taxonomic classification systems and use (e.g., agricultural,
companion, etc.).

B0FE98FDD5264590AA0FA9E2FD0E6706.description: Classify, evaluate and select animals based on anatomical and physiological characteristics.

698552B44CFE420081DB3EB2BC4EA477.description:
Identify and summarize the general standards that must be met in facilities for animal
production (e.g., environmental, zoning, construction, etc.).

39217C4050F6438D911E04F1CEC68B4C.description: Comply with government regulations and safety standards for facilities used in animal production.

F704C7B39A234F33BCF315D85ABD630A.description:
Identify and summarize equipment, technology and handling facility procedures used in
modern animal production (e.g., climate control devices, sensors, automation, etc.)

4003EF2062D94504A6A27B30F12EA09F.description:
Differentiate between the types of facilities needed to house and produce animal
species safely and efficiently.

EF9F0162911E4C02B33F9790404E051D.description:
Design animal housing, equipment and handling facilities for the major systems of animal
production.

AE79C3523FBA46779F84F6BEAEEC8AD7.description: Evaluate environmental factors affecting animal performance and implement procedures for enhancing performance and animal health.

94B3A6F15F8441328ABEB6EADC61A4C0.description:
Examine the use of quantitative breeding values (e.g., EPDs, Performance records,
pedigrees) in the selection of genetically superior stock.

93A6406176664159B02D5E90016E331C.description:
Analyze the processes of major reproductive management practices, including estrous
synchronization, superovulation, flushing and embryo transfer.

28D4DAA94AB147B1B6E5F0E0EB9B251F.description:
Identify and summarize the advantages and disadvantages of major reproductive
management practices, including estrous synchronization, superovulation, flushing and
embryo transfer (e.g., cost, labor, equipment, etc.)

318E97B559274637B9CB2479BADD56DA.description: Analyze the materials, methods and processes of artificial insemination.

17CEB0C534864136BE4635608B7A0A72.description:
Identify and categorize natural and artificial breeding methods (e.g., natural breedings,
artificial insemination, estrous synchronization, flushing, cloning, etc.)

445FC2ECD79A4E68ACFA826ADF4CFF5C.description: Apply scientific principles to breed animals.

83AAA71E857F4AAF975BD66E6331A3F7.description: Analyze the care needs for breeding stock in each stage of growth.

94017311DBFF4AA381282AB0A9890ED1.description:
Identify and summarize different needs of breeding animals based on their growth
stages (e.g., newborn, parturition, gestation, gestation lengths, etc.).

5851BCC820524FE69A357B12F9A8AB37.description: Identify and summarize genetic defects that affect animal performance.

3F57E6A2C1AC43799A509B3AE6B23DB3.description: Demonstrate how to determine probability trait inheritance in animals.

20F45245641F41899F2B5536685C9D50.description:
Identify and summarize inheritance and terms related to inheritance in animal breeding
(e.g., dominate, co-dominate, recessive, homozygous, heterozygous, etc.).

ED7CF6FD6A53411186542E2083BEC0B8.description:
Compare and contrast the use of genetically superior animals in the production of
animals and animal products.

34817081107A4ECDA98AEA299F0DAB36.description: Apply scientific principles to select and care for breeding animals.

34D3AFD5EA6E4F4DBD30932A3E6BCE92.description: Evaluate reproductive problems that occur in animals.

D822A962EB3048D08E39D7A98CFB7A66.description: Assess and describe factors that lead to reproductive maturity.

197657BEEECF4FF08EEC62946FD14673.description:
Compare and contrast how age, size, life cycle, maturity level and health status affect
the reproductive efficiency of male and female animals.

B42F9301B1B74B2B939575F8505A3ED4.description: Analyze the functions of major organs in the male and female reproductive systems.

12B92058A4614F8681071D9ED192490D.description:
Identify and categorize the male and female reproductive organs of the major animal
species.

5E02C42CA76F4861B2E6E5F0A3A36C86.description: Evaluate animals for breeding readiness and soundness.

492C8A48B8764CC7AACBD4589AE92B81.description: Apply principles of animal reproduction to achieve desired outcomes for performance, development and/or economic production.

E2286B44E382489982636A4FB989AB80.description:
Examine and summarize the meaning of various components of feed labels and feeding
directions.

7AC83B0CA7244839AE0148888E5CE2A0.description:
Identify and categorize tools and equipment used to meet animal nutrition needs and
ensure an abundant and safe food supply.

AE08BE308CC74DA4BD9B26000EB4D27C.description: Utilize industry tools to make animal nutrition decisions.

5036C0B663B04936947139F90B4CA4DC.description:
Compare and contrast methods that utilize feed additives and growth promotants with
production practices that do not (e.g., organic versus conventional production methods).

479B2454357C4B64BB98E67D50F1C12A.description:
Examine the purpose, impact and mode of action of feed additives and growth
promotants in animal production.

362AFDA587094AA2875AEBEF05834B02.description:
Examine the importance of a balanced ration for animals based on the animal’s growth
stage (e.g., maintenance, newborn, gestation, lactation, etc.).

3D2B8268123A42CBB3C4CF6CC347315E.description:
Determine the relative nutritional value of feedstuffs by evaluating their general quality
and condition.

936543E6BB4A4FF598F2F6E051BB36E6.description:
Compare and contrast common types of feedstuffs and the roles they play in the diets of
animals.

0D59527F116A46B7B002240C60F68C93.description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.

4794867AE9AA4C62A3F7468BCAC25507.description: Correlate a species’ nutritional needs to feedstuffs that could meet those needs.

B36259C8D2D749E9B74279F435C34997.description: Differentiate between nutritional needs of animal species.

69740288615B4C998AFE139A89D09BB7.description:
Differentiate between nutritional needs of animals in different growth stages and
production systems (e.g., maintenance, gestation, natural, organic, etc.).

ED5E7E18588A47EDB665DF0472687AF4.description:
Identify and summarize essential nutrients required for animal health and analyze each
nutrient’s role in growth and performance.

F73E2986299747FB80F12E681C4B215E.description: Analyze the nutritional needs of animals.

D3A31388E4D24515AE3C6704A18F9AD7.description: Design and provide proper animal nutrition to achieve desired outcomes for performance, development, reproduction and/or economic production.

B0042298DAA1478CB7A6E33C9D2F2B2E.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of animal and/or premise identification programs for a given
species.

2A6E141AFAB545EEBE799438B81B9CD1.description: Research and summarize animal production practices that may pose health risks.

62AD3A9CE1904399BDEACB1BD999B1C5.description:
Identify and categorize tools, technology and equipment used in animal husbandry and
welfare to help provide an abundant and safe food supply.

42377E803A0746B08FE32F46EE812811.description:
Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption (e.g., use in food
systems, etc.).

E57613CCDE524C87885CA746A6AD8FC4.description:
Research and summarize the challenges involved in working with animals and
resources available to overcome them (e.g., tools, technology, equipment, facilities,
animal behavior signals, etc.).

D205CF10E2B5412F8E2CFEF5AE6FABC2.description: Explain the implications of animal welfare and animal rights for animal systems.

3109AF4F0D8E46EAA6B08C6E8D252453.description: Demonstrate management techniques that ensure animal welfare.

94F34AF63A304BB7BEC77E35B7EEBFAE.description: Utilize best-practice protocols based upon animal behaviors for animal husbandry and welfare.

4ABD4FB946B2489083E075E41E481200.description: Distinguish between the types of laws pertaining to animal systems.

5674E6670EA64E02A6922DAE86336D2C.description: Analyze and apply laws and sustainable practices to animal agriculture from a global perspective.

D859F9C299EE4E1DA81C43AD9887BE49.description:
Research and examine marketing methods for animal products and services (e.g.,
conventional, niche markets, locally grown, etc.).

4FE0AB1EFB99481B86440BDE1028A7D5.description:
Analyze the impact of animal production methods on end product qualities (e.g., price,
sustainability, marketing, labeling, animal welfare, etc.)

EED87098440A447CA108A4162923E560.description:
Identify and categorize terms and methods related to animal production (e.g.,
sustainable, conventional, humanely raised, natural, organic, etc.)

6BE9FDCDEC604C57A7F4358777149846.description:
Assess and select animal production methods for use in animal systems based upon their
effectiveness and impacts.

2F144FAFB6934CF7904712B6E6B097FD.description:
Research and summarize major components of animal systems (e.g., livestock,
companion animals, etc.).

080C4DBB7337492891A239B635FCAEA3.description:
Identify and summarize the origin, significance, distribution and domestication of
different animal species.

4D65657F43F547B6915556DC9875AFA9.description:
Evaluate the development and implications of animal origin, domestication and distribution on
production practices and the environment.

CDE6BC430E4B4D5285765C911ED189C9.description: Analyze historic and current trends impacting the animal systems industry.

3FE4964423A24DC49556FD03EB5E7414.description:
Research ways that Animal Science or the skills needed may be implemented as a
Supervised Agricultural Experience, and other FFA activities that might involve Animal
Science.

26B8E29D3D2B48639471F5CBFC8504EB.description:
Examine the Livestock Evaluation, Horse Evaluation, Poultry Evaluation and Veterinary
Science Career Development Events for opportunities to exhibit skills needed in Animal
Science.

2DDC4125AD2846EBBCAA689E3776EDFF.description:
Assess the opportunities in Animal Science available through Career Development Events,
Supervised Agricultural Experiences and other FFA activities.

0AD821C65A1C4A5DACDD804CFC8FF2A3.description:
Analyze personal skillset and create a plan for obtaining the required education, training
and experiences to obtain a career in Animal Science.

4073D6416DC941ADB60F74559D480888.description:
Examine the educational, training and experiential requirements to pursue a career in
Animal Science (e.g., degrees, certifications, training, internships, etc.).

193A0138E973489D871BDBFD6CAEC87B.description:
Evaluate and implement the steps and requirements to pursue a career opportunity in Animal
Science.

B9AF8B98E1A94754BC81DD6827813FE4.description: Examine Career and FFA Opportunities associated with Animal Science.
